CatDescriptText: Mrs. Burney Spencer, 85 Main Street, Coraopolis, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 5, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Which do you think people give priority recognition to, the acquisition of money or achievement?" answer reads: "It looks to me like people give more recognition to the acquisition of money."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Burney Spencer, wearing eyeglasses, light colored tweed coat with toggles, collar, and pockets, holding dark handbag and light colored shopping bag inscribed "Forsythe", standing in front of light colored concrete wall with stone wainscot, right store window displaying home accessories
